hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 20-day realized volatility falls below its 100-day rolling 20th percentile during a NEUTRAL regime, a subsequent 5% price breakout in either direction within 3 days will initiate a new directional regime (BULL or BEAR) that persists for at least 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility during neutral markets often precede significant directional moves as pent-up energy releases. The 20th percentile threshold identifies meaningful compression, while the 5% breakout filter reduces false signals from minor volatility spikes.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 20th percentile of its 100-day rolling window
BTC price breaks 5% above/below its 20-day high/low within 72 hours of volatility condition

exit_conditions.take_profit: Hold for 10 trading days after breakout, then exit
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout direction reverses (price returns inside 20-day range)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14 days after entry if no regime confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in a return to NEUTRAL regime within 5 days, or the average regime duration post-signal is less than 7 days.
